results.title: My life without Steve
results.brief_description: Through a study of one woman’s year in a room with a window, “My Life Without Steve” forms a narrative that catches its audience up in the collective memories of all those of us who have at some stage loved and lost. A multi-award winning production. Rated: PG

results.title: My life to live = Vivre sa vie: film en douze tableaux
results.creator_credit: Films de la Pleiade, Pierre Braunberger and Jean-Luc Godard
results.brief_description: Anna Karina is a young French woman, Nana, who casually drifts into prostitution. Separating his story into twelve scenes which follow the classic structure of the nineteenth century novel (“Vivre Sa Vie” is a very loose adaptation of the Emile Zola classic “Nana”) Jean-Luc Godard constructs a film that is as much an essay on sexual exchange, and a study of Anna Karina’s beautiful face, as it is a straightforward narrative of a young woman destroyed by exploitative men. “Vivre Sa Vie” was a breakthrough film for Godard, one which saw him not only experimenting formally with manipulation of sound and image, but also beginning to fracture narrative and developing his unique approach to using the film medium for philosophical exploration. What startles now on revisiting the film is how neither his techniques nor his speculations have dated. If anything, the film’s contemplation and examination of prostitution, linking the exchange in bodies to both consumerism and to male oppression, can be seen as a precursor to the explorations and analyses of second-wave feminism. The film also explores how the very apparatus of cinema can be utilised to commodify and abstract the female into object. But in one emotionally stunning scene, where a dejected Nana, no money in her pocket, contemplates the suffering of Falconetti as Joan of Arc in Carl Dreyer’s classic silent film, “Vivre Sa Vie” asks us to consider the transcendent possibilities of art to transform culture and economies. The luminous black and white photography is by Raoul Coutard and the simple, elegant music by Michel Legrand. The films full title in English is “My Life to Live: A Film in Twelve Scenes”. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: My Life to live
results.brief_description: Illustrates the experiences of a young college student in his search for and discovery of self-identity. Shows the importance of defining yourself and determining your own lifestyle, and the value of facing events from the past, and coming to terms with and handling feelings of personal guilt.

results.title: My life in pink = Ma vie en rose [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Haut et Court, Carole Scotta and Alain Berliner
results.brief_description:
This is a tale about a seven-year-old boy, from a loving family, happy and healthy, who has decided that when he grows up he wants to be a woman. Ludovic throws his parents life into turmoil as he dresses up in girl’s clothing, plays with make-up and plans to marry the boy next door. Ludovic’s parents and their peers react with alarm at Ludovic’s pronouncements but Ludovic himself is a very together child. Director and screenwriter Alain Berliner presents “Ma vie en rose” as a modern fable, replete with scenes of magic realism and flights of fancy. The difficulties faced by Ludovic’s sexuality are presented as mostly challenges for the parents rather than the child. The perspective of the film is mostly Ludovic’s - which makes for an engaging comedy/drama, as Ludo is such a warm and heartfelt character. A film about family, acceptance, and sexual orientation, this was Alain Berliner’s debut feature. Cast includes Michele Laroque, Jean-Philippe Ecoffey, Helene Vincent, Georges Du Fresne.
In French with English subtitles.

results.title: My Life as a Dog = Mit Liv Som Hund
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, FilmTeknik, Waldemar Bergendahl and Lasse Hallstrom
results.brief_description: A film about growing up in Sweden in 1959 as seen through the eyes of Ingemar. Ingemar has to confront death, sex, soccer, girls, abandonment and guilt. Based on the autobiographical novel by Reider Jonsson.

results.title: My life
results.creator_credit: Capella International, Jerry Zucker, Bruce Joel Rubin and Hunt Lowry
results.brief_description: Bob Jones (Michael Keaton) is an ordinary man dying of cancer. As a legacy to his unborn child, he attempts to make a video of his life as he perceives it. It is only when he is confronted with the artifice of his own existence that he becomes determined to come to grips not only with the past, but with the disease. Embarking on a new lifestyle and rigid self-examination, and aided by Mr Ho, a spiritual healer, Bob undertakes a voyage of self-discovery. Nicole Kidman stars as Gail Jones, and Dr. Haing S. Ngor as Mr. Ho. Unashamedly a tear-jerker, “My life” is a compelling and sentimental drama, which emphasises the dignity of the dying and the need to embrace life. Truly vomitous.

results.title: My left foot: the story of Christy Brown
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Granada International Productions and Noel Pearson
results.brief_description: Based on the autobiography of Christy Brown, this is the extraordinary true story of the Irish writer who overcomes the limitations imposed by cerebral palsy to live a life of zest, love and passion. Using his left foot, Christy channelled his words and images into best-selling novels, a true triumph against the odds. Daniel Day Lewis won an Academy Award for his performance as Christy Brown.

results.title: My lady nicotine
results.creator_credit: Documentary Films of India, M. Bhavnani, V.R. Sarma and Rustom Master
results.brief_description: India is the world’s third largest producer of tobacco. This film shows various aspects of this industry from the cultivation through to the manufacture of cigarettes, cigars, pipe-tobacco, beedis and snuff.

results.title: My island home
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tim Wilson and Roger Blais
results.brief_description: Prince Edward Island—a place of pleasant beaches, warm seas and endless sand. At the same time there is a surprising amount of activity in this “Garden of the Gulf.” You explore it with an Islander who knows its every delight.

results.title: My inspiration
results.brief_description: In this short, the narrator tells us how her son provides her with daily inspiration to live a good life. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.
